intro: Alcea ficifolia subsp. karsiana, commonly known as the Karsian hollyhock, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Caucasus region. It features upright, branching stems covered in velvety, greenish-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, rose-like flowers in shades of pink and red, typically blooming in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after addition to gardens and botanical collections.
